DOC.brief_summary: This study single blind randomize clinical trial compare efficacy behavioral intervention program versus vaginal cone Stress Urinary Incontinence ( SUI ) .
DOC.brief_title: Behavioral Intervention Program Vaginal Cones SUI
DOC.detailed_description: Detailed Description : In single-blind randomized clinical trial , 60 woman age 25-65 yr stress urinary incontinence randomly divide two group block randomization method ; behavioral intervention program ( n=30 ) insertion vaginal device , vaginal cone ( n=30 ) . Women behavioral intervention group instruct pelvic floor exercise bladder control strategy . Other group allocate use vaginal cone . They treat 12 week follow every 2 week . The subjective change severity SUI measure use Detection SUI Severity Questionnaire leakage index 3-day urinary dairy . The objective change measure pad test . These two group compare accord score special questionnaire quality life , strength pelvic floor muscle , capability participate social activity , severity urinary incontinence , number involuntary urine passage , take , 1 3 month finishing intervention . Data analysis do descriptive perceptive statistical method use SPSS .
DOC.criteria: symptom SUI , least three episode stress incontinence per week Age 2565 body mass index ( BMI ) â‰¤ 30 kg/m2 physical health chronic degenerative disease affect muscular nerve tissue vulvovaginitis , atrophic vaginitis , pregnancy active recurrent urinary tract infection advance genital prolepsis patient cardiac pacemaker
